titleStmt.title: J. W. Moore to Beriah Magoffin
CWG10543

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p:
Mount Sterling May 3rd 1861,
To his Excellency
Gov Megoffin

At the last term of the Montgomery Circuit Court Michael Oconnel was fined $60 for Keeping a tipling house, The selling was done, in his absence by a clerk, and without his knowledge as far as the jury shewed any thing, Oconnel keeps a very fair and gentell grocery here is an industrious & enegetic man -- began the world poor and is unable to pay the fine without serious injury I am satisfied he will not repeat the offense or allow it to be done I hope the governer will remit the fine. and have it immediately transmitted to the sheriff of this County as the replevy is now about out,

Montgomery Cir. Ct
$60 } Tipling
M, O Connell
Issd. May 7. 1861
